definitions.definition: move or cause to move in a circular direction wholly or partly around an axis or point.
examples: the big wheel was turning
synonyms: pivot More"the wheels were still turning"go around

definitions.definition: move (something) so that it is in a different position in relation to its surroundings or its previous position.
examples: we waited in suspense for him to turn the cards over

definitions.definition: move (a page) over so that it is flat against the previous or next page.
examples: she turned a page noisily
synonyms: leaf through "I turned over a few pages"

definitions.definition: change or cause to change direction.
examples: we turned around and headed back to the house
synonyms: do a one-eighty "I turned and headed back"bend
zigzag "the path turned to right and left"

definitions.definition: aim, point, or direct (something).
examples: she turned her head toward me
synonyms: train on "he turned his gun on Lenny"

definitions.definition: change the position of one's body so that one is facing in a different direction.
examples: Charlie turned and looked at his friend
synonyms: do a one-eighty "I turned and headed back"

definitions.definition: (of the tide) change from flood to ebb or vice versa.
pass around (the flank or defensive lines of an army) so as to attack it from the side or rear.
perform (a somersault or cartwheel).
twist or sprain (an ankle).
examples: sprain, twist, wrench; hurt he turned his ankle

definitions.definition: fold or unfold (fabric or a piece of a garment) in the specified way.
examples: he turned up the collar of his coat

definitions.definition: remake (a garment or a sheet), putting the worn outer side on the inside.
set or print (a type or letter) upside down.
bend back (the edge of a blade) so as to make it blunt.
change in nature, state, form, or color; become.
examples: Emmeline turned pale
synonyms: turn out to be; Morebe transformed into
grow into "their honeymoon turned into a nightmare"become
reconstruct "he turned the house into apartments"

definitions.definition: cause to change; cause to become.
examples: potatoes are covered with sacking to keep the light from turning them green

definitions.definition: (of leaves) change color in the autumn.
pass the age or time of.
examples: I've just turned forty

definitions.definition: (with reference to milk) make or become sour.
examples: the thunder had turned the milk

definitions.definition: (with reference to the stomach) make or become nauseated.
examples: the smell was bad enough to turn the strongest stomach
synonyms: make someone sick "the sight of blood turns my stomach"

definitions.definition: send or put into a specified place or condition.
examples: the dogs were turned loose on the crowd

definitions.definition: start doing or becoming involved with.
examples: in 1939 he turned to films in earnest

definitions.definition: go on to consider next.
examples: we can now turn to another aspect of the problem
synonyms: switch to "we can now turn to another topic"

definitions.definition: go to for help, advice, or information.
examples: who can she turn to?

definitions.definition: have recourse to (something, especially something dangerous or unhealthy).
examples: he turned to drink and drugs for solace

definitions.definition: shape (something) on a lathe.
examples: the faceplate is turned rather than cast

definitions.definition: give a graceful or elegant form to.
examples: a production full of so many finely turned words

definitions.definition: make (a profit).
an act of moving something in a circular direction around an axis or point.
examples: a safety lock requiring four turns of the key

definitions.definition: a change of direction when moving.
examples: they made a left turn and picked up speed

definitions.definition: a development or change in circumstances or a course of events.
examples: life has taken a turn for the better
synonyms: revive "his luck took a turn for the better"deteriorate
decline; informalgo downhill "even the doctors were surprised when Richie took a turn for the worse"development
surprise "she was unprepared for this turn of events"

definitions.definition: a time when one specified period of time ends and another begins.
examples: the turn of the century

definitions.definition: a bend or curve in a road, path, river, etc.
examples: the twists and turns in the passageways

definitions.definition: a place where a road meets or branches off another.
examples: bend, corner, turning, turnoff, junction, crossroads we're approaching the turn

definitions.definition: the beginning of the second nine holes of a round of golf.
examples: noun: the turn

definitions.definition: a change of the tide from ebb to flow or vice versa.
one round in a coil of rope or other material.
an opportunity or obligation to do something that comes successively to each of a number of people.
examples: it was his turn to speak
synonyms: crack "you'll get your turn in a minute"

definitions.definition: a short performance, especially one of a number given by different performers in succession.
examples: a comic turn

definitions.definition: a performer giving one of a number of short performances.
a short walk or ride.
examples: why don't you take a turn around the garden?

definitions.definition: a shock.
examples: you gave us quite a turn!

definitions.definition: a brief feeling or experience of illness.
examples: tell me how you feel when you have these funny turns

definitions.definition: the difference between the buying and selling price of stocks or other financial products.
a profit made from the difference between the buying and selling price of stocks or other financial products.
a melodic ornament consisting of the principal note with those above and below it.
